conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for Chapter 16 of the main campaign and for Chelle's adventurer story.
Mmm, yes. I quite like this dress indeed. Place the order at once.
Very good, Your Highness. I am certain the tailor will be honored by your patronage.
And what of the...other item I asked you to prepare?
All is proceeding smoothly, Your Highness. It could be ready as early as today.
Very good. Tell everyone in the lab I look forward to seeing the fruits of their hard labor.
Understood. Now begging your pardon, I shall continue the preparations.
All according to plan. My new dress is ready, development of the secret weapon is on schedule...
What's with the list, Chelle?
That is everything I need before departing for North Grastaea.
There are many considerations when a lady such as myself goes abroad.
Hm, okay. This list says something about a purrty as well?
Oh yes, the party is one of the final requirements for my upcoming travels.
I fail to see the connection.
Your Highness, the princess of North Grastaea's Fadden Kingdom has arrived.
Speak of the devil... Bring her through. I would receive her at once.
I am Yelda, eldest princess of the Kingdom of Fadden. It's a pleasure to finally meet you.
The pleasure is all mine. I am Chelle, third princess of the Kingdom of Alberia.
Oh, and this is my pactbound dragon, Cat Sìth.
You are as beautiful as the stories say, Princess—and your dragon is most divine as well. It is truly an honor to be standing here with you both.
The honor is mine, truly. You have my thanks for accepting my invitation.
Well then, you must be tired from your journey. Please make yourself at home in the palace until the welcoming gala.
I am very much looking forward to it, Princess Chelle! Your lively parties have long been the talk of the land.
And who was that just meow?
Were you not listening? She is the princess from the Kingdom of Fadden.
That's the country in the north you've been sending your little kittens to, mmm?
Was all of that in purrperation for today?
It was indeed. I've invited Princess Yelda to Chanzelia in order to form an alliance.
Between Alberia and Fadden?
As we will soon be heading north, I think it behooves us to have as many allies there as possible.
Yes, but why Fadden in purrticular?
Though Fadden is a small kingdom, I believe we will soon become the best of allies indeed.
Well, you're usually right about that kind of thing.
Eee hee hee! Tonight's party is going to be an even grander affair than normal! That is the only proper way to mark a new friendship, after all.
Ah, so THAT'S why you said the purrty was part of your travel plans.
Quick on the uptake as always, Cat Sìth. Now then, aren't we missing someone?
I hear pawsteps as we speak.
Captain Leif of the White Sparrows reporting, Your Highness.
You kept me waiting, Leif. Is aught amiss?
Nothing of import, Your Highness. It does me good to see you again.
But goodness! Your outfit is so... Er...
Eee hee hee! It's quite unusual for you to comment on my appearance, Leif.
Is this dress not lovely? I had it made specially for the journey north.
It suits you perfectly, Your Highness...
I sense a ＂but＂ at the end of that sentence. Go on. Out with it already.
Pray forgive my impudence, Highness, but I find it a touch revealing.
Such a short hem ill suits a member of the Alberian royal family.
Eee hee hee! Oh, but this is wonderful! I never thought to get the mother hen treatment from YOU of all people!
Have you suddenly developed a sense of humor, perchance?
I am most serious.
Well then, rest easy, my fussy friend; I assure you I have a very good reason for this garment.
A normal dress would be too restrictive for the journey that lies ahead, you see.
This dress is designed for function above all else. Do you understand now?
Your reasoning is sound, Princess, and yet...
And yet you cannot find a respectable place to set your eyes. Is that it?
Pray do not jest about such things.
Oh, you are no fun. But that's what makes you you.
You know me well, Princess. Now then, why was I summoned here?
Surely you have retainers aplenty with more fashion sense than I.
Yes, let us cut to the chase: I have an important duty that can only be entrusted to you, Captain.
I am ever your sword, Highness. Might I ask the nature of the task?
You will serve as my escort for the party!
Me?! Your escort?!
Thank you one and all for coming to this celebration of the newfound friendship between Alberia and Fadden!
Let us raise our glasses in a toast to our continued prosperity and friendship!
My, but you Fadden nobles certainly are skilled dancers!
I can't remember the last time I enjoyed myself so much on the floor.
I am honored to be complimented by one as discerning as you, Princess Chelle.
And despite your humble modesty, Leif, I was quite impressed by you as well.
You flatter me, Your Highness.
Though it wouldn't have hurt for you to dress up a bit more.
Forgive me, Princess, but this is the proper dress uniform for a knight such as myself.
You're quite the gentleman, aren't you? How simply divine!
Princess Chelle, thank you again for arranging such a lavish party in our honor.
Chanzelia truly is the radiant city! Everything here shines so brightly... I'm actually a touch envious.
Ah, but I've heard the palace in Fadden is quite the sight to behold as well—in particular your stained glass works.
I understand this selfsame glass can be found at the August Cathedral in the Holy City of Grams. Is that correct?
Indeed it is—and I pray our newfound alliance will soon permit Fadden glass to bedeck the halls in Chanzelia as well.
Far better here than in that wretched city...
Strong words indeed. Do you truly find Grams to be so intolerable?
Ah, but I seem to remember your country is reliant on them—a relationship you seek to free yourselves from.
You understand the situation correctly, Princess—and I imagine that is, in part, why you have deigned to invite is here?
I imagined you would appreciate it. Chanzelia, too, has deep ties to Grams, after all.
Perhaps you would be so good as to inform me what YOU hoped to achieve by accepting my invitation.
I think you already know: Fadden is a harsh and barren land, and we depend on Grams for most of our food imports.
Because of that, they have felt the need to become increasingly involved in our domestic affairs.
Our attempts to create trade routes with other countries have been bogged down by wars and having to curry favor with Grams.
Yes, it's never easy to cut ties.
Indeed. Our country boasts skilled craftsmen, as well as rich mineral deposits for creating artistic marvels.
Yet what good is such beauty if a person is not truly free to enjoy it? One cannot make a meal of stained glass, after all.
I will speak plain: We seek a way free of our current situation, a way to ensure our people go hungry no longer. And we feel this alliance would serve just that end.
You are a kind and caring princess. And you may rest assured.
Once our alliance becomes official, I will immediately establish new supply routes between Chanzelia and Fadden.
This is almost too good to be true. Oh, but I am so relieved!
Was something in particular troubling you?
Even in North Grastaea, we hear tell of Chanzelia and its wondrous manacasters.
Tongues wag with tales of the princess who has excavated these weapons and seeks to develop new ones, so I'd thought to find you a bit...well...rougher.
But having met you in person, I now realize that reputation is unearned.
You dance beautifully and rule prudently. THAT is the true nature of the manacaster- toting princess I've heard so much about.
My, that's quite the epithet. But does that not describe you as well?
I hear that Fadden is hard at work excavating its own manacasters.
Excavating, yes—but nothing more. Our technology isn't yet at the level where we can make use of them.
In truth, I pray for a world in which we NEVER have to use them.
And I as well. My interest in manacasters is driven by curiosity more than anything.
It's natural for people to seek knowledge,  just as it's natural for them to seek peace.
Princess Chelle, I think this may be the beginning of a wonderful friendship.
And as we are becoming closer, might I ask you one thing?
Certainly.
Are you and Leif perchance betrothed?
Not at all. I am a princess and he is my knight—nothing more.
Oh... I was entirely convinced you were in a relationship out of a romance novel.
It is rather rare for a knight to escort his charge to a function such as this.
Leif is the most trustworthy man I know, which is why I wanted him at my side.
One never knows what might happen at a diplomatic party.
Yes, of course.
You surprise me, Princess Yelda! I'd not pegged you as one who engaged in idle court gossip.
Everyone enjoys a good love story, do they not?
Alas, love often doesn't work out for princesses like us. Mine certainly didn't.
So if you two actually WERE a couple, I would cheer you both on until my throat was hoarse!
Well, I can see I read too much into the situation. Perhaps I'll go have another dance to cool my head.
Let us take the floor as well, Leif.
I trust you remember the dance I taught you?
...Do you truly mean to form an alliance with Fadden, Princess?
If something about the situation is troubling you, Leif, be out with it.
Do not mistake me—Princess Yelda certainly seems to be a woman of honor.
And yet, I cannot help but think there is another side to her.
And what is the reason for this suspicion?
Fadden fiercely resents the meddling of the Holy City of Grams, as you well know.
So it's perfectly understandable why they would seek to form new alliances.
But that being said, why Alberia? Our current situation is... Well...
You're saying there's no merit to seeking  an alliance with a country that so  recently was ruled by a demon god and whose throne currently sits empty?
A touch blunter than I was looking for, but yes. Additionally, I've not heard anything about Fadden engaging in actual revolt against their Grams overseers.
They have animosity, yet it hasn't moved them to action. There must be a reason.
Which is part of why I asked them here.
Then you will form the alliance even with such questions still swirling about?
How else am I to get to the bottom of what is really going on?
The meetings to formalize the alliance begin tomorrow—and believe me, Leif, I will be watching what they say and do with GREAT interest.
Princess Yelda's Guest Room
Non-aggression pact... Trade agreement... None of this should be an issue for the Chanzelia side, which leaves only—
Princess Yelda, do you truly plan to include THAT condition as well?
They have rejected similar proposals from two other countries already. If we handle this poorly, this alliance could collapse before it even begins.
All the more reason to include it. Our backs are against the wall now, and this condition is most critical.
I will do whatever it takes to secure the future of Fadden, and I will brook no discussion on that point.
Alliance Negotiations
...And with that, the trade agreement is finalized between Chanzelia and Fadden.
The final matter is the joint development of weaponry. I believe this proposal comes from the Fadden side?
Indeed it does. As you know, our country has also been excavating manacasters— but there is much we could still learn from you, the eminent pioneers in the field.
I am confused, Princess. I thought you stood against the use of such weapons.
Naturally, my ultimate hope is for all to live in a world without war.
But I am not naive. I know we must have the power to protect our home until that day arrives.
Moreover, as both of our countries are  involved with manacasters, would it not be best for us to engage in the sharing of information on the subject?
General Bertrand? I would hear your thoughts on this matter.
Hmm... I suppose I have no objections.
Truly?!
Well, so long as the general approves, I hereby decree that Fadden's proposal be reflected in our agreement in its entirety.
As you wish, Princess Chelle.
We shall sign the agreement tomorrow. And with that, discussions are concluded. Thank you, everyone.
Princess Yelda, might you care to join me for a spot of tea?
Oh, uh, yes. Of course.
Here you are. I have a number of different  varieties, so please don't hold back if you'd like to sample them all.
Thank you very much.
Is your meowting over already?
You know I cannot stand overly long meetings; they are a waste of everyone's precious time.
If I wish to spend hours dancing around an issue, I will host a ball.
To be honest, I was surprised things managed to wrap up so quickly.
In particular, I had imagined the joint  development of manacasters to be more of a sticking point.
Oh? Why is that?
I understand you rejected proposals from both Svenitla and Barthe to export your  weapons to them.
Knowing how particular you are about the export of new technologies, I feared our proposal might prove a bridge too far.
Ah, but there is a simple explanation: We have more to gain from your proposal than we did from theirs.
For there are currently manacasters being excavated in your country that we do not possess ourselves, as well as rare minerals we can use in their construction.
Even my usually stodgy advisors saw the wisdom in the deal. Perhaps I have educated them better than I thought!
Although General Bertrand seemed quite incensed with you just before the meowting began, did he not?
Any organization needs at least one person willing to push back against the leader. Without that, the center cannot hold.
I've no wish to be surrounded by yes-men. Rather, I seek counsel only with those who can best serve Chanzelia.
You continue to impress, Princess.
Oh, it's nothing so grand. And yes, while arms proliferation IS an issue, if we permit our research to stagnate, someone else will doubtless surpass us.
We must open our doors to the outside and find partners who can help us continue our development.
Such is how a country must behave in this  new age, wouldn't you agree?
It is exactly as you say!
For us it will begin with weapons, but I pray we can soon work together in agriculture, construction, and other fields!
Such a future gets to the very heart of our alliance.
I hope this will be the beginning of a long and fruitful relationship.
I as well, Princess Chelle. May both our nations prosper for years to come.
Well, with that settled, I believe it's time for a little pre-alliance celebration. I think a party is in order!
Thankfully, my dress has been cleaned and is ready for use once more.
It is just so easy to dance in... Perhaps I should have more made!
I beg your pardon, Princess Chelle, but do you have a moment?
Ah, Leif. How fortuitous of you to come when I find myself in need of a dance partner yet again.
I've not the time for that, Princess; I fear I am here to tell you that I do not agree with your methods.
You don't wish to attend the party?
I refer to this alliance itself.
Alas, I fear you are too late, dear Leif. There can be no turning back now that we have come this far.
But—
Cat Sìth, show Leif out.
But Your Highness!
You may wait outside until you are sent for.
Tonight I will dance alone.
*sigh*
Whatever is the matter?
Does it have something to do with your not being accompanied by Sir Leif?
Oh, who cares where that blockhead is?
Would you like to talk about it?
I'm afraid it is rather a personal matter, and not something I should be discussing with guests from abroad.
But surely we are friends now?
And as your friend, I seek only to lend you an ear and some comfort.
Well, I suppose there IS something I would like to get off my chest...
You see, I was once engaged.
But my fiancé tried to sell us out to Grams...and I was the one who brought him to justice.
Ah! I... I see...
That experience taught me how hard it is to find someone you can share even your deepest ambitions with.
And now I've experienced something similar yet again. One thing people never understand about royalty is how so very LONELY it can be.
You have to be constantly on your guard to ensure you aren't being used.
I know just how you feel.
Being royalty doesn't mean you always get what you want—far from it, in fact.
We are both princesses, and I believe we understand each other better than anyone else possibly can.
As this is the start of a lifelong friendship, perhaps we should consult with—and  confide in—each other?
It as you say. We are frien—
What was that?! Guards!
Here, Your Highness!
Where did that explosion come from?!
Princess Yelda's room, Highness.
This is clearly the work of a Grams assassin who seeks to thwart our alliance!
Evacuate the other guests at once.
Cat Sìth!
You rang?
Lead the search for the assassin while I escort Princess Yelda to safety.
Will you be all right on your own?
Yes—in fact, that will be more expedient. I will await your good news.
This way, Yelda!
Right!
What is this place?
It is a manacaster research facility reconstructed from ancient ruins.
Connected directly to the palace? Heavens, what a thing.
Surprising, isn't it? Only a few know of this evacuation route, so hopefully the assassin is not among them.
Is it wise for us to travel together like this without guard or escort?
Normally it wouldn't be, but this is a unique situation.
My palace's defenses are second to none, yet someone breached your very room.
This has the stink of treachery about it.
Yes, if the culprit were one of my own guards or servants...
It would have been a simple matter for them to plant something in your room.
And if that were the case, they might have been hoping for us to evacuate along with all of the others.
They could finish the job as they liked before disappearing into a sea of people.
How perfectly awful.
As such, I'm sure you see the wisdom in staying put until we hear from Cat Sìth.
I'm quite impressed, Chelle. You really thought this through.
...But I'm afraid I did as well.
It would be best if you didn't make any sudden movements, Your Highness.
I'm not terribly used to casters yet, and I'd hate for this to go off by accident.
Where did you get that?
I'm sorry to say that I lied to you.
I said we hadn't yet developed any  operable manacasters in Fadden...
But in truth, we succeeded in restoring one of the weapons we excavated.
Oh? You simply MUST tell me how you managed such a feat.
Using intelligence our spies extracted from Chanzelia, of course.
But restoring just this one took an immense amount of time. We're nowhere near mass production.
Hence the inclusion of the joint development pact in our treaty.
A treaty scheduled to be ratified tomorrow, might I add. So why would you resort to this manner of treachery now?
We have received a more favorable offer...
One from the Holy City of Grams.
And here I thought the two of you didn't get along.
In exchange for your assassination and all of the stolen manacaster technology, they have agreed to cede a food-producing region of their territory to us.
So the explosion was just another part of your trap.
You made it look like you were the target so you might isolate me instead...
Yes...to everyone else, it would appear that the host nation's princess bravely gave her life to protect her guest.
Still, aren't you forgetting something? That caster will be of little use if I decide to shapeshift.
You would never take an action that might plunge your land into war.
If I were to be killed by a dragon, all suspicion would fall on you.
And if I am slain by a caster, it will be easy to lay blame at the feet of one from Chanzelia who opposes the alliance.
Exactly! For how could I slay you when we possess no such weaponry?!
Speaking of which, I will be able to pilfer some fine technology from this facility. You were a trusting fool to lead me here.
All that's left is to pull this trigger and save my country from famine!
Is that truly what this is about?
What?
Fadden was presented with two choices: unite with Alberia or unite with Grams.
Both choices have merit on the surface, but do you trust Grams to follow through? TRULY trust them, I mean?
After all, this is the very country that meddles endlessly in your affairs—the very country whose yoke you seek to cast off your collective necks.
And yet you take their offer over mine.
Ah, but it is a shame how quickly everyone looks for the easy way out.
In fact, Chanzelia once had a weak-minded ruler who sought the easy path.
SILENCE!
I would thank you to keep his name out of your unworthy mouth.
It is your fault he died! Yours!
Elua loved peace above all, and his death is on YOUR head!
Elua?!
How do you know my fiancé's name?
Because before he was your betrothed, he was mine.
I was to be married off to Elua so the gap between North and South Grastaea might finally be bridged.
However, due to the wishes of his nation's royal family, Elua's family chose to marry the third heir to Alberia instead.
But then my love was betrayed by the very woman he was engaged to— betrayed and sent to execution!
So it's about revenge, is it?
Yes! Revenge for my murdered love! And if I can save my nation from starving in the bargain, so much the better.
I trust you sufficiently understand the situation now. If you have any last words, I suggest you make them here.
Might I suggest cursing your own name for being so foolish as to bring me to this place alone with you?
Oh, I am not the fool here.
What do you mean?!
Remember my plan? We were to stay put and await good news from Cat Sìth.
And here her news is, right on time! Borne by a white sparrow, no less.
HAAAH!
Gah! My manacaster!
I've secured the weapon, Chelle. Cat-astrophe averted!
Your Highness, are you all right?
I'm fine. Good work, the both of you.
But...that's the knight you didn't want at the party!
Did you truly believe we were fighting? I'm a better actor than I thought...
But my spies overheard you! Ah! I mean...
There's no need to hide it. Diplomatic events are battlefields of espionage.
That's why I removed Leif. To cause you to drop your guard.
And to get you reveal your true intentions, I created this situation and feigned the role of the pure and foolish princess.
Then this was a trap?! ALL OF THIS was a trap?!
How long have you known that I was intending to kill you?
From the moment you arrived.
All of these ＂alliance＂ discussions have just been my way to suss out Grams' attack dog.
WHAT?!
We won't be able to avoid Grams on our journey north.
So we needed a way to determine who else was looking to cause us trouble.
If we laid out the red carpet, I figured any country with hostile intentions would come swooping in.
It always pays to know who your enemies are—and to eliminate them.
You have played me for the fool.
Oh, we've both been playing the same game—it's the only one we royals really know how to engage in, after all.
Well then, it seems I have lost.
Giving up so easily? Tsk.
I don't see much of an option at this point; what plan I had now lies in tatters.
Neither of us can kill the other without starting a war.
As such, I would request that you keep these events secret, and in exchange, you may ask of me whatever your heart desires.
A wise decision. I too have no desire to see this situation escalate.
So then, in exchange for remaining mum about this little incident...
...Yes?
I insist we go ahead and formalize the alliance between Alberia and Fadden.
Are we to be your puppets, then? Is that it?
These are my terms: First, Fadden and Alberia will bring no harm to the other.
Secondly, Fadden and Alberia will create and maintain a mutual trade network.
And finally, Fadden and Alberia will agree to jointly develop manacaster technology.
But that is the very alliance we negotiated during my visit here!
Yes, and nothing has changed in the meantime.
I don't understand! Why would you form an equitable alliance with a country that has betrayed you?!
For the sake of future generations.
Future generations?
If we take advantage of you, they will only come to hate us as you do Grams now.
And as I said before, joint development of manacasters benefits us as well.
What's more, we now have one less enemy in the north, just as I'd hoped.
I believe Fadden hopes for the same?
Diplomacy is about negotiating the most beneficial outcome for one's country, not being swayed by impulse or emotion.
I can forge friendships with people I cannot personally forgive if I do so for the sake of my country.
So you can maintain your relationship with Grams...or form a new one with us.
Which one holds the brighter future for Fadden? Think hard, and do not be swayed by something so petty as revenge.
A royal should be ashamed to bring their personal affairs into the governance of their country.
I... On behalf of Fadden...I choose...
The treaty is signed and sealed. All's well that ends well!
Though I still think you went too easy on them, considering they tried to kill you.
We accomplished our goal, and so long as there is no demerit for us, it pays to have others in our debt.
Still, it was a bold stroke to raise her tail by talking about your old fiancé and such! Meowr hawr hawr!
Though even she knew better than to react to it while others were present.
I'm glad it motivated her to carry out the assassination. It allowed me to hear her true feelings.
You may be happy, but I still personally object to your being placed in such a risky situation, Princess.
A master must use every piece on her chessboard—even the queen.
And besides, once my little kittens gave you the word, you stormed in to save me.
I've always dreamed of a handsome prince riding to my rescue!
I would ask what would have happened if I'd been late, but I know you were more than prepared to defend yourself.
You noticed that, did you?
That little number is small enough to stay hidden in my dress—and I really MUST thank those scientists.
Still, I'm glad I didn't have to use it; violence has no place in diplomacy.
Princess Yelda didn't understand that. Though to be fair, I imagine it was the Cardinal who pushed her into this.
Speaking of, since I'm headed that way anyway, I think it's time I had him dance with me as well.
Princess, I...
Yes, Leif? What is it?
...Pray take care of yourself. I await your safe return.
Naturally. You didn't train me up just to have me fail now.
And with preparations complete, it's time to deploy for a party in the north!
